decision_reasoning: Board's conclusion was reasonable based on the evidence presented
evidence_assessment: applicant failed to demonstrate deep convictions as a conscientious objector due to lack of proactive actions or participation in anti-conscription activities
application_details: applicant argued his testimony was uncontradicted but failed to convince the Board otherwise
cause_of_action: applicant sought refugee protection in Canada as a conscientious objector fearing persecution for refusing military service in Turkey
procedure_followed: Judicial review of the Immigration and Refugee Board's decision denying refugee status under sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
result_of_case: Federal Court dismissed the application for judicial review, upholding the Board's decision
